title: Estadi Palamós Costa Brava
text:
The Estadi Municipal Palamós Costa Brava is a multi-use stadium located in <a href="Palam%C3%B3s">Palamós</a>, <a href="Catalonia">Catalonia</a>, Spain. It is currently used for <a href="Association%20football">football</a> matches and is the home stadium of <a href="Palam%C3%B3s%20CF">Palamós CF</a> and <a href="UE%20Costa%20Brava">UE Costa Brava</a>.
History.
Palamós Costa Brava was inaugurated on 29 August 1989 under the name of "Nou Estadi Municipal de Palamós", being the new home stadium of <a href="Palam%C3%B3s%20CF">Palamós CF</a> and replacing Camp de Cervantes. Its first match was a 2–1 <a href="Exhibition%20match">friendly</a> win against neighbours <a href="FC%20Barcelona">FC Barcelona</a> on the same day.
The stadium's first competitive match took charge on 10 September, a 1–1 draw against <a href="Levante%20UD">Levante UD</a> for the <a href="Segunda%20Divisi%C3%B3n">Segunda División</a> championship. This was the club's most successful period, as it remained in the second level for six consecutive campaigns.
On 7 July 2014 the stadium was named as the new home ground of <a href="UE%20Llagostera">UE Llagostera</a> for the following five seasons, as the club's stadium, "Estadi Municipal de Llagostera", didn't meet the <a href="Liga%20de%20F%C3%BAtbol%20Profesional">LFP</a> criteria. On 2 August, it was renamed to "Estadi Municipal Palamós Costa Brava".
In the 2015 summer, the stadium was renovated by adding seats in all the stands, and had its capacity reduced to 3,724 spectators. On 27 July 2021, Llagostera announced that the club would play in the stadium again for the ensuing campaign; four days later, the club changed name to <a href="UE%20Costa%20Brava">UE Costa Brava</a>.
